Description: A small fragment of a rock crystal vessel: with an incised inscription of Peribsen. The text is cut on what is most probably the inner surface of the vase. Good condition.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Merneit, Excavator's mark Y. 19
Curator's comments: The piece bears the excavator's mark, Y.19, which was presumably used to indicate that this was the nineteenth fragment from the tomb. Numbers of the same form were employed by Petrie to refer to the subsidiary graves, and Y.19 could stand for the grave marked 19 beside the tomb of Merneit, shown in 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, pl.LXI. It is more likely that the inscribed fragment came from the main tomb rather than the subsidiary grave, but confusion could be caused if the same system of numbering occurs on less distinctive objects. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, 38 and pl. IV, 7; R. Weill, 'IIe' et 'IIIe Dynasties', 118.
